cards.name: Sea of Clouds
cards.text:
Sea of Clouds enters the battlefield tapped unless you have two or more opponents.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.
cards.flavor: Skybridges from across Kylem converge at the grand stadium of Valor's Reach.

rulings.text: If you began the game with two or more opponents but now only have one opponent left, these lands enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.originalText:
Sea of Clouds enters the battlefield tapped unless you have two or more opponents.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.

cards.name: Spire Garden
cards.text:
Spire Garden enters the battlefield tapped unless you have two or more opponents.
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.
cards.flavor: From thrilling combat to unparalleled vistas, Valor's Reach has it all.

rulings.text: If you began the game with two or more opponents but now only have one opponent left, these lands enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.originalText:
Spire Garden enters the battlefield tapped unless you have two or more opponents.
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.

cards.name: Angel of Retribution
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor: Bitter vengeance never glowed so bright nor sang so sweet.
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Angelic Chorus
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor: The harmony of the glorious is a dirge to the wicked.

rulings.text: This does not trigger on a permanent being turned into a creature. That is just a permanent changing type, not something entering the battlefield.
Angelic Chorus does not trigger when creatures phase in or change controllers.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Angelic Gift
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Angelic Gift enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has flying.

rulings.text: If the target of an Aura becomes illegal before the spell resolves, the Aura won't resolve and will be put into its owner's graveyard. It won't enter the battlefield and you won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Angelic Gift enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.name: Battle Mastery
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor:
"There is elegance in all the Ojutai do—even their killing."
—Kirada, Silumgar enforcer

rulings.text: If a creature loses double strike after dealing combat damage in the first combat damage step, it won't assign combat damage in the second one.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike.

cards.name: Champion of Arashin
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: "The blood of Dromoka and the blood of my veins are the same."
cards.originalText: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Doomed Traveler
cards.text: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.
cards.originalText: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.name: Expedition Raptor
cards.text:
Flying
When Expedition Raptor enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

rulings.text: You can't put more than one +1/+1 counter on any one target using the support action.
Support can target a creature you don't control.
If a spell with support has other abilities that target creatures, those abilities and the support ability can target the same creature.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Expedition Raptor enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

cards.name: Kor Spiritdancer
cards.text:
Kor Spiritdancer gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.
Whenever you cast an Aura spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: She reaches beyond the physical realm, touching the ideals from which all creatures draw their power.

rulings.text: If you cast an Aura spell, Kor Spiritdancer's second ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of it. The ability will resolve before the spell does.
The second ability triggers when you cast any Aura spell, not just one that targets Kor Spiritdancer.

cards.originalText:
Kor Spiritdancer gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.
Whenever you cast an Aura spell, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Land Tax
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can fetch any of the "Snow-Covered" lands, since they all also have the supertype basic.

This ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.
You shuffle your library if you search, even if you don't put any basic land cards into your hand.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Lightwalker
cards.text: Lightwalker has flying as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"The greatest gift Dromoka gives is the ability to fly without wings."
—Urdnan, Dromoka warrior
cards.originalText: Lightwalker has flying as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Long Road Home
cards.text: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: The person who finishes a journey is rarely the same as the one who starts it.

rulings.text: If that creature is exiled during an end step, it won't come back until the next turn's end step.
If a creature token is exiled this way, it will cease to exist and won't return to the battlefield.

At the time the creature is exiled, Auras attached to it will be put into their owners' graveyards. Any Equipment will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on it at that time will cease to exist.
If a double-faced card is exiled this way, it'll return with its front face up. It gets a +1/+1 counter even if it isn't a creature.
If a melded permanent is exiled this way, the two cards will both return with their front faces up. Each gets a +1/+1 counter.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Loyal Pegasus
cards.text:
Flying
Loyal Pegasus can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavor:
"Even if I should die in the saddle, she will not let me fall to the ground."
—Hypatia of the Winged Horse

rulings.text: Loyal Pegasus can be declared as an attacker only if another creature is declared as an attacker at the same time. Similarly, Loyal Pegasus can be declared as a blocker only if another creature is declared as a blocker at the same time.
If you control more than one Loyal Pegasus, they can both attack or block together, even if no other creatures attack or block.

Although Loyal Pegasus can't attack alone, other attacking creatures don't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Loyal Pegasus could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls.

In a Two-Headed Giant game (or in another format using the shared team turns option), Loyal Pegasus can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Loyal Pegasus can't attack or block alone.

cards.name: Mangara of Corondor
cards.text: {T}: Exile Mangara of Corondor and target permanent.
cards.flavor: "I have been brought to this place and I cannot leave. I may be free of the amber, but I am still in prison."

rulings.text: If Mangara of Corondor leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the targeted permanent will still be exiled.
If the target permanent becomes an illegal target, the ability won't resolve and Mangara will remain on the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: コロンドールのマンガラ

cards.originalText: {T}: Exile Mangara of Corondor and target permanent.

cards.name: Midnight Guard
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, untap Midnight Guard.
cards.flavor:
"When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk
cards.originalText: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, untap Midnight Guard.

cards.name: Oreskos Explorer
cards.text: When Oreskos Explorer enters the battlefield, search your library for up to X Plains cards, where X is the number of players who control more lands than you. Reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The value of X is determined as Oreskos Explorer's triggered ability resolves.
If no player controls more lands than you do, you'll still search and shuffle your library, although you can't find any cards.

cards.originalText: When Oreskos Explorer enters the battlefield, search your library for up to X Plains cards, where X is the number of players who control more lands than you. Reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.name: Raptor Companion
cards.flavor: A raptor will follow any order as long as that order is "hunt," "kill," or "go for the guts."

cards.name: Rebuke
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.flavor:
"No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.originalText: Destroy target attacking creature.

cards.name: Royal Trooper
cards.text: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Loyalty guides me. Pride compels me. Anger sustains me. And the pay isn't bad."
cards.originalText: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shoulder to Shoulder
cards.text:
Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Sea Gate may have fallen, but we still stand. We still fight."
—Gideon Jura

rulings.text: You can't put more than one +1/+1 counter on any one target using the support action.
Support can target a creature you don't control.
If a spell with support has other abilities that target creatures, those abilities and the support ability can target the same creature.

cards.originalText:
Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Silverchase Fox
cards.text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Silverchase Fox: Exile target enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Be careful in your hunt. The clever little creature can steal your wards and lead you right into the werewolf's den."
—Britta, midwife of Gatstaf
cards.originalText: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Silverchase Fox: Exile target enchantment.

cards.name: Solemn Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"You will be reimbursed for your donation."
"The reimbursement is spiritual."
—Temple signs

rulings.text: If the targeted permanent is an illegal target by the time Solemn Offering would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Sparring Mummy
cards.text: When Sparring Mummy enters the battlefield, untap target creature.
cards.flavor: Aspiring to earn their place in the afterlife, acolytes train every day against those who fell short of that glory.
cards.originalText: When Sparring Mummy enters the battlefield, untap target creature.

cards.name: Steppe Glider
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
{1}{W}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains flying and vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It glides over the landscape. It also happens to be one.
cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance
{1}{W}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains flying and vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
cards.flavor:
The smallest seed of regret can bloom
into redemption.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature's power is negative, its controller doesn't lose or gain life.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

cards.name: Take Up Arms
cards.text: Create three 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens.
cards.flavor:
"Many scales make the skin of a dragon."
—Abzan wisdom
cards.originalText: Create three 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens.

cards.name: Tandem Tactics
cards.text: Up to two target creatures each get +1/+2 until end of turn. You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: In times of infestation and war, Zendikar favors the blades that strike in unison.

rulings.text: You can cast Tandem Tactics with no targets. When it resolves, you'll gain 2 life. However, if you cast Tandem Tactics with any targets and all of those targets are illegal as it tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 2 life in that case.

cards.originalText: Up to two target creatures each get +1/+2 until end of turn. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Benthic Giant
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor:
"Some fates you can see coming for you, plain as day, and there's nothing you can do about them."
—Callaphe the mariner
cards.originalText: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Call to Heel
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller draws a card.
cards.flavor: On Bant, a sigil is both a prize of honor and a bond of duty. The one who bears it may be called to fulfill that charge at any moment.

rulings.text: The player who draws a card is the player who controls the creature when Call to Heel resolves. This may not be the player whose hand the creature is put into.
If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target before Call to Heel resolves, Call to Heel doesn't resolve. No one draws a card.

cards.originalText: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller draws a card.

cards.name: Claustrophobia
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor: Six feet of earth muffled his cries.

rulings.text: Claustrophobia can target and enchant a tapped or untapped creature.
The enchanted creature can still be untapped in other ways. Claustrophobia will remain attached, and the creature will continue to not untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Coralhelm Guide
cards.text: {4}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor:
"She knows every step of this coastline, both above and below the surface, and she has hideouts all along the way. She will get you there."
—Jori En, expedition leader

rulings.text: Activating Coralhelm Guide's ability after a creature has become blocked won't cause that creature to become unblocked.

cards.originalText: {4}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Fog Bank
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Fog Bank.
cards.flavor:
"The union of sea and sky makes a perfect cover."
—Talrand, sky summoner

rulings.text: Fog Bank's prevention effect isn't considered while assigning combat damage from a creature with trample. For example, if it blocks a 5/5 creature with trample, that creature's controller must assign 2 of that creature's combat damage to Fog Bank and the remainder can be assigned to the defending player or planeswalker.

cards.originalText:
Defender, flying
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Fog Bank.

cards.name: Frost Lynx
cards.text: When Frost Lynx enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: It readily attacks much larger prey, knowing retaliation is impossible.

rulings.text: Frost Lynx's ability can target a creature that's already tapped. That creature still won't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText: When Frost Lynx enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Impulse
cards.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.flavor: "You call it luck. I call it preparation."

rulings.text: This is not a draw.
Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.

cards.originalText: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Kitesail Corsair
cards.text: Kitesail Corsair has flying as long as it's attacking.
cards.flavor: "Why perch in the crow's nest when I can fly like the crows?"

rulings.text: Kitesail Corsair has flying immediately after it attacks. This means that combat restrictions on creatures with flying (such as that of Sandwurm Convergence) don't apply, but abilities that trigger on creatures with flying attacking (such as that of Windreader Sphinx) do trigger.

To determine the total cost of a Dinosaur spell, start with the mana cost or alternative cost you're paying, add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. The converted mana cost of the creature remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.

cards.originalText: Kitesail Corsair has flying as long as it's attacking.

cards.name: Kraken Hatchling
cards.flavor: A spike and a maul are needed to crack their shells, but the taste is worth the effort.

cards.name: Mystic Confluence
cards.text:
Choose three. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
• Return target creature to its owner's hand.
• Draw a card.

rulings.text: You choose the modes as you cast the spell. Once modes are chosen, they can't be changed.

If a mode requires a target, you can select that mode only if there's a legal target available. Ignore the targeting requirements for modes you don't choose. Each time you select that mode, you can choose a different target, or you can choose the same target.

No matter which combination of modes you choose, you always follow the instructions of a Confluence in the order they are written. If the same mode is chosen more than once, you choose their relative order as you cast the spell.
No player can cast spells or activate abilities in between the modes of a resolving spell.
If a Confluence is copied, the effect that creates the copy will usually allow you to choose new targets, but you can't choose new modes.

If all targets for the chosen modes become illegal before the Confluence resolves, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. If at least one target is still legal, the spell will resolve but will have no effect on any illegal targets.

cards.originalText:
Choose three. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
• Return target creature to its owner's hand.
• Draw a card.

cards.name: Negate
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.
cards.flavor:
"It is fascinating to see how the people of this plane replicate magical techniques without a natural gift. Also frustrating."
—Jace Beleren

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.name: Nimbus of the Isles
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: The people of the Sevick Isles have a unique understanding of the term "ominous clouds."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Omenspeaker
cards.text: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.flavor: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.

rulings.text: When you scry, you may put all the cards you look at back on top of your library, you may put all of those cards on the bottom of your library, or you may put some of those cards on top and the rest of them on the bottom.
You choose how to order cards returned to your library after scrying no matter where you put them.
You perform the actions stated on a card in sequence. For some spells and abilities, that means you'll scry last. For others, that means you'll scry and then perform other actions.

Scry appears on some spells and abilities with one or more targets. If all of the spell or ability's targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't scry.

cards.originalText: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Opportunity
cards.text: Target player draws four cards.
cards.flavor: "Opportunity isn't something you wait for. It's something you create."
cards.originalText: Target player draws four cards.

cards.name: Oracle's Insight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Scry 1, then draw a card." (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

rulings.text: When you scry, you may put all the cards you look at back on top of your library, you may put all of those cards on the bottom of your library, or you may put some of those cards on top and the rest of them on the bottom.
You choose how to order cards returned to your library after scrying no matter where you put them.
You perform the actions stated on a card in sequence. For some spells and abilities, that means you'll scry last. For others, that means you'll scry and then perform other actions.

Scry appears on some spells and abilities with one or more targets. If all of the spell or ability's targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't scry.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Scry 1, then draw a card." (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Peregrine Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Peregrine Drake enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.
cards.flavor:
"Always a welcome sight breaking through the clouds."
—Talrand, sky summoner

rulings.text: You choose which lands to untap as the triggered ability resolves. They aren't targeted, and they don't have to be lands that you control.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Peregrine Drake enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor:
"The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks."
—Jace Beleren
cards.originalText: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.

cards.name: Reckless Scholar
cards.text: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.
cards.flavor: Progress comes at a price.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.

cards.name: Sower of Temptation
cards.text:
Flying
When Sower of Temptation enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature for as long as Sower of Temptation remains on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: One glamer leads him far from home. The next washes away his memory that home was ever anywhere but at her side.

rulings.text: You retain control of the targeted creature as long as Sower of Temptation remains on the battlefield, even if a different player gains control of Sower of Temptation itself.
If Sower of Temptation leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability will have no effect.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sower of Temptation enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature for as long as Sower of Temptation remains on the battlefield.

cards.name: Spell Snare
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost 2.
cards.flavor: With practice, the measurement of magic can lead to its mastery.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell with converted mana cost 2.

cards.name: Switcheroo
cards.text: Exchange control of two target creatures.
cards.flavor: Say hello to your new friend.

rulings.text: If one of the target creatures is an illegal target when Switcheroo resolves, the exchange won't happen.
You don't have to control either target.
If the same player controls both creatures when Switcheroo resolves, nothing happens.
Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText: Exchange control of two target creatures.

cards.name: Tidespout Tyrant
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell, return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The stadium tests more than just fighting skill. For example, swimming ability.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell, return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Totally Lost
cards.text: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Fblthp had always hated crowds.
cards.originalText: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: True-Name Nemesis
cards.text:
As True-Name Nemesis enters the battlefield, choose a player.
True-Name Nemesis has protection from the chosen player. (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything controlled by that player.)

rulings.text: Protection from a player is a new variant of the protection ability. It means the following: — True-Name Nemesis can't be the target of spells or abilities controlled by the chosen player. — True-Name Nemesis can't be enchanted by Auras or equipped by Equipment controlled by the chosen player. (The same is true for Fortifications controlled by the chosen player, if True-Name Nemesis becomes a land.) — True-Name Nemesis can't be blocked by creatures controlled by the chosen player. — All damage that would be dealt to True-Name Nemesis by sources controlled by the chosen player is prevented. (The same is true for sources owned by the chosen player that don't have controllers.)

cards.originalText:
As True-Name Nemesis enters the battlefield, choose a player.
True-Name Nemesis has protection from the chosen player. (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything controlled by that player.)

cards.name: Watercourser
cards.text: {U}: Watercourser gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Beware an eddy where there should be none or a stretch that flows too fast or too slow."
—Old Fishbones, Martyne river guide
cards.originalText: {U}: Watercourser gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Assassin's Strike
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its controller discards a card.
cards.flavor: When Selesnya missionaries moved into the Shanav Quarter, they faced scorn, ridicule, and ultimately martyrdom.

rulings.text: You must be able to target a creature to cast Assassin's Strike.
If the creature is an illegal target when Assassin's Strike tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. Its controller won't discard a card.
If Assassin's Strike resolves but the creature isn't destroyed (perhaps because it regenerated or has indestructible), its controller will discard a card.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. Its controller discards a card.

cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Daggerdrome Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: One of the many reasons why open-air markets close at dusk.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Diabolic Intent
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You must choose a card if there are any in your library.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Doomed Dissenter
cards.text: When Doomed Dissenter dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: There is only one fate left to those banished from the God-Pharaoh's city.
cards.originalText: When Doomed Dissenter dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.name: Eyeblight Assassin
cards.text: When Eyeblight Assassin enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Boggart blood disgusts me almost as much as the foul creatures themselves."
cards.originalText: When Eyeblight Assassin enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fill with Fright
cards.text: Target player discards two cards. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.originalText:
Target player discards two cards.
Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Grotesque Mutation
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+1 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

rulings.text: multiple instances of lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+1 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Hand of Silumgar
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Silumgar trains those whom he favors in his magic, granting them the ability to spread his disdain across the land.
cards.originalText: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Last Gasp
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Takedowns in Valor's Reach are never meant to be lethal, but that doesn't mean they won't be incredibly painful.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Liturgy of Blood
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.flavor:
"You harbor such vast potential. It would be such a shame to let you die of old age."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

rulings.text: Liturgy of Blood isn't a mana ability and uses the stack. Players can respond to it by casting spells and activating abilities.
If the target creature is an illegal target when Liturgy of Blood tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't add mana to your mana pool.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. Add {B}{B}{B}.

cards.name: Morbid Curiosity
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Draw cards equal to the converted mana cost of the sacrificed permanent.
cards.flavor: "Every creation carries a piece of its creators. Their knowledge, their dreams, their soul. That is the best part."

rulings.text: If a permanent has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.
To determine how many cards to draw, use the converted mana cost of the permanent immediately before you sacrificed it.
If an effect copies Morbid Curiosity, the controller of the copy will draw the same number of cards as determined by the original. Its controller can't and doesn't have to sacrifice a permanent.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Draw cards equal to the converted mana cost of the sacrificed permanent.

cards.name: Nirkana Revenant
cards.text:
Whenever you tap a Swamp for mana, add an additional {B}.
{B}: Nirkana Revenant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Hate is an everlasting wellspring from which it is eternally sustained.
cards.originalText:
Whenever you tap a Swamp for mana, add an additional {B}.
{B}: Nirkana Revenant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Noosegraf Mob
cards.text:
Noosegraf Mob enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever a player casts a spell, remove a +1/+1 counter from Noosegraf Mob. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

rulings.text: If Noosegraf Mob is no longer on the battlefield or no longer has +1/+1 counters on it as its triggered ability resolves, you can't remove a counter from it and won't get a Zombie token.
You can't remove more than one +1/+1 counter from Noosegraf Mob at once to get more Zombie tokens, and you can't choose not to remove a counter.
Noosegraf Mob's triggered ability resolves before the spell that caused it to trigger.

cards.originalText:
Noosegraf Mob enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever a player casts a spell, remove a +1/+1 counter from Noosegraf Mob. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.name: Noxious Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Noxious Dragon dies, you may destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.
cards.flavor: Dragons of Silumgar's brood begin to digest their prey even before consuming it, letting their caustic breath do much of the work.

rulings.text: A face-down creature has a converted mana cost of 0. However, its converted mana cost changes when it's turned face up. Thus, if a creature is turned face up in response to being targeted by Noxious Dragon's ability, it may become an illegal target.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Noxious Dragon dies, you may destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.

cards.name: Nyxathid
cards.text:
As Nyxathid enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Nyxathid gets -1/-1 for each card in the chosen player's hand.
cards.flavor: Born of volcanic forces, it thrives on the absolute panic it inspires.

rulings.text: Nyxathid tracks the hand size of the chosen player even if that player ceases to be an opponent of its controller. (This could happen if that player gains control of Nyxathid, for example.)
In a multiplayer game, if the chosen player leaves the game, Nyxathid's second ability simply won't do anything anymore.

Nyxathid's two abilities are linked: The second one refers only to the player chosen by the first one. If another creature becomes a copy of Nyxathid (due to Mirrorweave, for example), the second ability won't do anything because a player was never chosen as a result of the first ability. This is true even if a different ability allowed a player to be chosen as that creature entered the battlefield.

If a spell or ability causes the chosen player to draw cards and then discard cards, Nyxathid's power and toughness changes accordingly as that spell or ability is resolving. For example, if the chosen player has five cards in hand and a spell causes that player to draw two cards then discard two cards, Nyxathid will start out as 2/2, then become 1/1, 0/0, and finally 2/2. This is because cards are always drawn one at a time, but multiple cards may be discarded at once. Although Nyxathid momentarily had 0 toughness while that spell was resolving, it isn't put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action because state-based actions aren't checked until the spell has finished resolving.

cards.originalText:
As Nyxathid enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Nyxathid gets -1/-1 for each card in the chosen player's hand.

cards.name: Painful Lesson
cards.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"You wish to remember this lesson? I will write it down for you."
—Senifet, vizier of Bontu
cards.originalText: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

cards.name: Prakhata Club Security
cards.flavor: It's rare that the Prakhata Club closes its doors. It's also rare that Lord Gonti meets with Consul Kambal. What are the odds the two would occur on the same day?

foreignNames.name: プラカタクラブの用心棒

cards.name: Quest for the Gravelord
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Gravelord.
Remove three quest counters from Quest for the Gravelord and sacrifice it: Create a 5/5 black Zombie Giant creature token.

rulings.text: Quest for the Gravelord's first ability triggers regardless of who controlled the creature and whose graveyard it was put into.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature dies, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Gravelord.
Remove three quest counters from Quest for the Gravelord and sacrifice it: Create a 5/5 black Zombie Giant creature token.

cards.name: Rotfeaster Maggot
cards.text: When Rotfeaster Maggot enters the battlefield, exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain life equal to that card's toughness.
cards.flavor: Is it at the top of the food chain or the bottom?

rulings.text: Rotfeaster Maggot's ability is mandatory. If you are the only player with creature cards in your graveyard, you must target one of them.

cards.originalText: When Rotfeaster Maggot enters the battlefield, exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain life equal to that card's toughness.

cards.name: Screeching Buzzard
cards.text:
Flying
When Screeching Buzzard dies, each opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"A shrill creature that delights in the misery of others—what's not to love?"
—Braids, dementia summoner
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Screeching Buzzard dies, each opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Shambling Ghoul
cards.text: Shambling Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Once he gets up and going, he will forever shamble on.
cards.originalText: Shambling Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Slum Reaper
cards.text: When Slum Reaper enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: It's sent into unguilded districts by the Orzhov to collect the souls of those no one will miss.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, you may sacrifice Slum Reaper itself. If you control no other creatures, you'll have to sacrifice Slum Reaper.

foreignNames.name: 貧民街の刈り取るもの

cards.originalText: When Slum Reaper enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Swarm of Bloodflies
cards.text:
Flying
Swarm of Bloodflies enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Swarm of Bloodflies.
cards.flavor: In the Gudul delta, bloodfly bites are indistinguishable from spear wounds.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Swarm of Bloodflies enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Swarm of Bloodflies.

cards.name: Tavern Swindler
cards.text: {T}, Pay 3 life: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 6 life.
cards.flavor: Rakdos cultists are her best customers. They never flinch at pain and are seldom good at math.

rulings.text: You can't activate Tavern Swindler's ability if your life total is less than 3. You can activate it if your life total is exactly 3, but it's probably a bad idea. You'll lose the game before the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 3 life: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 6 life.

cards.name: Tenacious Dead
cards.text: When Tenacious Dead dies, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control.
cards.flavor: Raising the bones of Hekjek the Mad proved far easier than getting them to lie back down.

rulings.text: You decide whether to pay {1}{B} when the ability resolves. If you choose not to, you won't get another chance later.

If you control a Tenacious Dead owned by another player when it dies, you'll control the triggered ability. However, if you choose to pay {1}{B}, it will be put onto the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.originalText: When Tenacious Dead dies, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control.

cards.name: Bathe in Dragonfire
cards.text: Bathe in Dragonfire deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: The scent of cooked flesh lingers in the charred landscape of Tarkir.
cards.originalText: Bathe in Dragonfire deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Battle Rampart
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I will build no sanctuaries. The safety you seek can be won only by the sword."
—Yannash, outpost builder
cards.originalText:
Defender
{T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Battle-Rattle Shaman
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may have target creature get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The shaman rattles not to inspire a battle fury but to drown out the shrieks of those fleeing the Eldrazi.

rulings.text: Battle-Rattle Shaman's ability triggers when the beginning of combat step starts during each of your turns. It resolves before you declare attackers.
If a spell or ability causes your turn to have multiple combat phases, Battle Rattle Shaman's ability triggers during each of them.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may have target creature get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.
cards.originalText: Blaze deals X damage to any target.

cards.name: Blood Feud
cards.text: Target creature fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor: Succession is a matter of blood, and by blood it is often decided.

rulings.text: Blood Feud can target two creatures with the same controller.

cards.originalText: Target creature fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Boldwyr Intimidator
cards.text:
Cowards can't block Warriors.
{R}: Target creature becomes a Coward until end of turn.
{2}{R}: Target creature becomes a Warrior until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Now everyone knows what you are."

rulings.text: Coward is a new creature type.
Each of the activated abilities replaces all creature types the affected creature may have had.
Note that the exact wording of this card has changed since it was printed in the _Future Sight_(TM) set, but its functionality is the same.

foreignNames.name: ボールドウィアの威嚇者

cards.originalText:
Cowards can't block Warriors.
{R}: Target creature becomes a Coward until end of turn.
{2}{R}: Target creature becomes a Warrior until end of turn.

cards.name: Borderland Marauder
cards.text: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Though she is rightly feared, there are relatively few tales of her deeds in battle, for few survive her raids.
cards.originalText: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Chain Lightning
cards.text: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to any target. Then that player or that permanent's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, they may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

rulings.text: The copy is a spell, so it can be targeted by other spells and abilities that target a spell.
The player putting the copy spell on the stack controls that spell.
The spell copy has all the text and can result in itself being copied.

As Chain Lightning resolves, the targeted player or the controller of the targeted creature may copy it. The copy has the same text, target, and color of the resolving spell, though the player who's copying it may choose a new target for it. Once that copy is created (or not), the first Chain Lightning has finished resolving and leaves the stack.
The player putting the copy of the spell on the stack controls that copy.
The copy of Chain Lightning is created on the stack, so it's not cast. Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. Players may respond to that spell before it resolves.
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target when Chain Lightning tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. It can't be copied.

cards.originalText: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to any target. Then that player or that permanent's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, they may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

cards.name: Dragon Breath
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Breath from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Breath from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

cards.name: Dragon Hatchling
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Those dragons grow fast. For a while they feed on squirrels and goblins and then suddenly you're missing a mammoth."
—Hurdek, Mazar mammoth trainer
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Earth Elemental
cards.flavor: Earth elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

cards.name: Ember Beast
cards.text: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.
cards.flavor: The only livestock that will survive for long in the Smelting District, ember beasts serve many functions—none of them willingly.

rulings.text: Ember Beast can't attack or block unless another creature is also assigned to attack or block at the same time. Notably, two Ember Beasts can attack or block together.
Once Ember Beast has been declared as an attacker or blocker, it doesn't matter what happens to the other creature(s).

Other creatures assigned to attack alongside Ember Beast don't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. Other creatures assigned to block alongside Ember Beast don't have to block the same creature as Ember Beast.

cards.originalText: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.

cards.name: Enthralling Victor
cards.text: When Enthralling Victor enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power 2 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
cards.flavor: If you stare at the sun for too long, you'll lose your ability to see clearly.

rulings.text: Once Enthralling Victor's ability resolves and you gain control of a creature, raising its power above 2 won't cause you to lose control of it. Similarly, it doesn't matter if Enthralling Victor leaves the battlefield or you lose control of Enthralling Victor. You'll keep control of the creature that was the target of the ability until the end of the turn.
Enthralling Victor's ability can target a creature that's already untapped. You'll still gain control of it and it will gain haste.

cards.originalText: When Enthralling Victor enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power 2 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Expedite
cards.text:
Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "I run, and thunder follows."
cards.originalText:
Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Flamewave Invoker
cards.text: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Inside even the humblest goblin lurks the potential for far greater things—and far worse.
cards.originalText: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.name: Goblin Razerunners
cards.text:
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a land: Put a +1/+1 counter on Goblin Razerunners.
At the beginning of your end step, you may have Goblin Razerunners deal damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Finding an unexplored world, they immediately set it on fire.

rulings.text: You don't count how many +1/+1 counters are on Goblin Razerunners until its triggered ability resolves.

If Goblin Razerunners leaves the battlefield after its ability triggers but before it resolves, the amount of damage it deals is equal to the number of +1/+1 counters that were on it as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a land: Put a +1/+1 counter on Goblin Razerunners.
At the beginning of your end step, you may have Goblin Razerunners deal damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to target player or planeswalker.

cards.name: Lightning Talons
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"The victim was either clawed to death or struck by lightning. Possibly both."
—Pel Javya, Wojek investigator
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has first strike.

cards.name: Magmatic Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, Magmatic Force deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: It's the pinnacle of utter destructiveness.

rulings.text: The controller of Magmatic Force when its ability triggers always chooses the target, even when the ability triggers during another player's upkeep.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, this ability triggers once at the beginning of each team's upkeep.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, Magmatic Force deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.name: Pathmaker Initiate
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: "The expected way through the trial is far too tedious."

rulings.text: If the creature's power is greater than 2 as the activated ability tries to resolve, the ability won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. However, if instead the creature's power is raised above 2 after the ability resolves, it still can't be blocked that turn.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Reckless Reveler
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Reckless Reveler: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"The gods of Theros are born of the expectations and beliefs of mortals. If I have found godhood, what does that say about their true desires?"
—Xenagos, god of revels
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice Reckless Reveler: Destroy target artifact.
